docs.lead_paragraph: We had many excellent entries in the contest to name the anything-goes games, the version of the Olympics without the drug tests. But there can be only one gold medal -- or perhaps the trophy should be a gold double helix, as suggested by WWRobertson.
docs.abstract: We have a winning name for our new anything-goes, drug-test-free version of the Olympics: The Rx Games. And maybe a winning rationale, too: What these athletes discover in their quests to improve their bodies might eventually contribute to prescriptions for better health for non-athletes.
